title: How to Set Time to Night in Minecraft

steps.title: Open your Minecraft world.
steps.content: Open your Minecraft world. Make sure cheats are enabled - by default, they're disabled in Survival worlds, but enabled in Creative worlds.

steps.title: Open the command line.
steps.content: Open the command line. Press / , sometimes read as ? , to open up the Minecraft cheat console. You can also press T and enter in a forward slash manually, but pressing / automatically puts in the slash.

steps.title: Enter the cheat.
steps.content: Enter the cheat. Type "time set 13000" or "time set night". The final command should look like /time set 13000 or /time set night .

steps.title: Hit Enter.
steps.content: Hit Enter. Once the processing is done, the game's time will change to night. You can enter the cheat /gamerule doDaylightCycle false to stop time from moving. To disable this cheat, just enter /gamerule doDaylightCycle true and time will begin moving again.
